article.headline: Cornell 90, Columbia 66
article.story: ITHACA, N.Y. (AP) -- Ka'Ron Barnes scored 19 points to lead Cornell to a 90-66 win over Columbia in the Ivy League opener for both teams Saturday. Cody Toppert scored 17 for Cornell (6-7, 1-0 Ivy League), while Graham Dow added 13 and David Lisle 10. Cornell shot 54 percent from the floor and tied a season high with 13 steals, including four by Barnes. The Big Red held a 40-28 edge in rebounds and hit 26 free throws, their most in a game this season. Trailing by 11 at halftime, Columbia got within eight on a 3-pointer by Jeremiah Boswell during Columbia's first possession of the second half. The Big Red followed with a 15-5 run to take a 55-37 lead. Cornell led by at least 20 points for the final nine minutes. Matt Preston scored 13 points, grabbed nine rebounds and had three assists to lead Columbia (4-10, 0-1). Dragutin Kravic added 10 points and Colin Davis had seven points and eight rebounds.
